text.title: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry

p.s: If you 're visiting an island , you may suddenly have to pick up a new driving skill : getting your vehicle onto a car ferry .
Luckily , it 's easier than it looks , and minimal preparation is required to make sure you have an easy trip .

item.s: It is sometimes possible to purchase tickets online .
If the ferry company you are traveling with does not allow this , you will have to purchase your ticket at the terminal .
Ticket booths will be available .
Different booths will sell tickets to different destinations so be sure to read the signs carefully .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 1.jpg

item.s: The line-up will consist of many different lanes .
Your ticket will tell you which lane you are to go into .
After choosing the correct one , park as close as possible to the vehicle in front of you .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 2.jpg

item.s: The wait will be a while and it is not good to continue to release harmful emissions into the environment .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 3.jpg

hi.s: Start your vehicle when you notice your lane beginning to move .

item.s: Follow the vehicles ahead of you onto the ferry .
You may need to make a variety of complex and tight turns onto various ramps and overpasses .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 4.jpg

hi.s: There have been incidents where the ramp leading onto the ferry has collapsed with vehicles on it , dropping them into the water .

item.s:
For this reason , it is important to perform a variety of different procedures to be able to escape quickly from your vehicle should it fall off of the ramp .
a )
Open all windows as far as possible .
Ensure that objects do not blow out .

The water pressure will be too strong to open your windows under water . ( Although power windows will continue to operate when submerged , the water pressure will be too great for them to function ) .

list.item:
b )
Release all seat belts .
Although you should wear your seat belt at all times while riding in a moving vehicle , make sure you are not wearing it now as it may take precious seconds to release it should your vehicle fall into the water .
Ignore the seat belt warning if it begins to beep .

c )
Make sure all doors are unlocked
.
If the doors of your vehicle lock automatically when you place it in
Drive
, override this function by pressing the
unlock
button on the driver 's door .

hi.s: Begin to drive onto the ferry .

item.s: Make sure step 5 is completed before reaching the final ramp ( the one bridging the ferry and the terminal ) .
Continue to follow the direction of the terminal staff .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 6.jpg

item.s: As you enter the ferry , continue to follow the direction of the crew .
The crew will direct you to a parking spot .
It is essential that you follow their directions as it is their job to ensure that the weight of all vehicles are distributed evenly throughout the ship .
Otherwise , the boat could tip over .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 7.jpg

item.s: Once you have been directed to your final parking spot , park your vehicle within twenty four centimeters of the vehicle in front of you .
This will maximize the number of vehicles that can be fit on the ferry .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 8.jpg

item.s:
Place your vehicle in
Park
after engaging the parking brake .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 9.jpg

item.s: Lock your vehicle , but do not activate the alarm .
If the crossing gets a bit bumpy , the movement may set off your car alarm , and lead to nuisance and potential embarrassment .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 10.jpg

item.s: When it is time to disembark , do not start your engine until the other vehicles in your lane begin to move .
This will reduce the amount of emissions in the ferry .

figure.rend: Drive Your Car on to a Ferry Step 11.jpg

item.s: Do not talk or text message on your cell phone while driving onto the ferry .
Driving onto a ferry requires concentration and one false move could cause an accident .
